content: Tom has twice as many pencils as Jane, and Jane has 4 more pencils than Sam. If Sam has 6 pencils, how many pencils does Tom have?

Let's see. So, Sam has 6 pencils. Jane has 4 more pencils than Sam, so Jane has 6 + 4 = 10 pencils. Tom has twice as many pencils as Jane, so Tom has 2 * 10 = 20 pencils. I think that's it. Tom has 20 pencils.
